page.title: 03HEALTH IN BETHERSDEN
page.content: THE MAIN CENTRES OF POPULATION ARE CONNECTED TO MAIN DRAINAGE,THE SEWAGE BEING TREATED LOCALLY AT A SEWAGE PLANT SITED IN NORTON LANE.OUTLYING HOUSES HAVE CESSPOOLS EMPTIED BY PRIVATE CONTRACTORS.MOST DWELLINGS HAVE ELECTRICITY AND ALL HAVE MAINS WATER.REFUSE COLLECTION BY VEHICLES OF ASHFORD BOROUGH COUNCIL IS ON A WEEKLY BASIS.THE HEALTH REQUIREMENTS OF THE AREA ARE GENERALLY SERVED BY A NATIONAL HEALTH DOCTOR LIVING IN WOODCHURCH AND HAVING AN AREA PRACTICE WITH A SURGERY OPENING 4 DAYS A WEEK IN BETHERSDEN.THIS SURGERY ALSO SERVES AS A DISPENSARY.DISTRICT NURSES RENDER TREATMENT IN PEOPLES HOMES ON THE INSTRUCTION OF A DOCTOR.A CLINIC FOR CHILDREN UNDER 5 YEARS IS HELD MONTHLY IN THE VILLAGE HALL.HANDICAPPED PERSONS ARE ABLE TO USE THE FACILITIES PROVIDED BY A DAY CENTRE IN TENTERDEN.
